image.altText: Lauren Willgoose walks alongside an older woman outside the court

props.synopsis: Lauren Jean Willgoose has asked a court to be sentenced to home detention for causing the crash which killed prominent neuropsychologist Anthony Walsh, because she would be "devastated" to be separated from her young son if she is jailed. Prosecutor Michael Foundas described her pregnancy as a "reckless decision".

title.children: Lawyer made 'reckless decision' to get pregnant while awaiting crash sentence

props.synopsis: A police dog has escaped unscathed after the vehicle he was in was set alight in Adelaide’s north-eastern suburbs on Sunday.

title.children: Police dog escapes injury after patrol car set alight in Adelaide's north-east

image.altText: An elderly man with a long beard and long white hair

props.synopsis: Peter Smith was 65 when he was bashed to death in his Mount Gambier unit by Paul Roomes in September 2023. Mr Smith's brother says the family is satisfied with the sentence handed to Roomes.

title.children: Family of man bashed in home 'can grieve properly now' as killer sentenced

image.altText: 'Welcome to Genius Gungahlin' sign on a building.

props.synopsis: Genius Childcare centre in Gungahlin will be temporarily shut down by the ACT regulator after it received a spate of reports about child health and safety breaches.

title.children: Canberra childcare temporarily shut 'in the best interest of children'

image.altText: Australian golf legend and former LIV Golf CEO Greg Norman.

props.synopsis: South Australia could continue to host LIV Golf for at least another six years, with the state government unveiling plans to invest in a Greg Norman-designed upgrade to the North Adelaide golf course at a cost the premier said would become publicly available "within the state budget".

title.children: LIV Golf locked in, with mooted move to Greg Norman-designed course

image.altText: A school class photo featuring more than 20 students with one child left out. The left out child is symbolized by a silhouette

props.synopsis: As South Australia's parliament considers new child protection laws, advocates are questioning whether the state has become "over-zealous" in protecting children from harm.

title.children: Student's removal from class photos sparks debate over SA's child protection laws

image.altText: A weapon allegedly uncovered by SA Police.

props.synopsis: A home-owner injured by a thief during a robbery in regional SA will face court charged with weapons offences after detectives allegedly uncovered items — including an explosive — following the break-in, police say.

title.children: Break-in victim arrested after explosive found, SA Police says

image.altText: A beautiful large black snake with orange stripes

props.synopsis: It has been a "flat out" summer for snake catchers dealing with the slithering reptiles around Adelaide and nearby towns, while a vet reports treating more bites than usual.

title.children: More snake sightings in SA this summer with hatchlings on the way

image.altText: Joaquin Niemann waves his hat to the crowd as CHAMPION is visible on the big screen

props.synopsis: Chile's Joaquin Niemann has fired a seven-under final round to win LIV Golf's Adelaide tournament by two strokes from Mexico's Abraham Ancer.

title.children: Niemann wins LIV Adelaide as Aussie team fails to fire

image.altText: close up of man playing a saxophone

props.synopsis: One of the longest-performing and most far-out jazz outfits ever seen, on this planet at least, is coming to Australia.

title.children: Jazz band to 'transmoleculise' into Australia for Womadelaide

image.altText: Woman holding sign with kids and famer husband perched at the end of a stone work Orroroo Sign

props.synopsis: Almost two dozen regional councils in South Australia have banded together to share how childcare shortage is impacting parents living in their region.

title.children: The challenges of living in one of Australia's worst childcare deserts

image.altText: Victoria Police Acting Assistant Commissioner Shane Patton speaks to the media.

props.synopsis: Victoria's police chief, Shane Patton, resigned from his role just two days after a no-confidence vote from his officers.

title.children: Victorian premier says 'overwhelming' vote led to police chief's exit

image.altText: Media Mogul Rupert Murdoch poses for a photograph with his sons Lachlan  and James at his wedding in 2016.

props.synopsis: Thousands of pages of court documents and an exclusive interview reveal details of the Murdoch family trust court case.

title.children: Murdoch's 'troublesome beneficiary' broke his silence — here's what he said

image.altText: A man standing and speaking, while a young boy next to him picks his nose, and another man sits behind a desk

props.synopsis: The Trump administration has halted the firing of hundreds of workers in nuclear weapons programs, with experts warning a new agency aimed at cutting cost will put communities at risk.

title.children: Trump administration tries to rehire fired nuclear weapons workers

image.altText: Cassius Turvey Forever 15

props.synopsis: The teenager, who was 15 at the time and can't be identified, tells a Perth court he was stabbed in October 2022, four days before Cassius Turvey was hit with a metal pole and chased into bushland.

title.children: Teenager attacked by trio accused of murdering Cassius Turvey, court told

image.altText: A man dressed in hospital scrubs and a bandanna holds a baby which has its face blurred.

props.synopsis: A court hears a prominent Perth obstetrician was allegedly crying, driving erratically and had been drinking before his Jaguar slammed into a Honda, killing a young woman.

title.children: Perth obstetrician speeding and drunk before fatal Dalkeith crash, court hears

image.altText: Coogee local Erik de Haart stands in front of a memorial commemorating the bali bombing victims in coogee

props.synopsis: Mr de Haart pulled victims from the wreckage of Bali's Sari Club after bombs orchestrated by terrorist groups exploded, killing 202.

title.children: Bali bombings survivor, Sydney man Erik de Haart dies aged 67

image.altText: Three women cropped together into one photo

props.synopsis: Almost three quarters of households with a mortgage in the electorate of Lyons are in stress — and a handful of votes may decide the key seat next federal election.

title.children: 'People can't keep going like this': Inside a mortgage-stressed electorate

image.altText: Composite image of six victims of jumping castle tragedy with school signage as background

props.synopsis: A lawyer representing the operator of a jumping castle that flew into the air resulting in six students dying in 2021 calls on a judge to make "very adverse findings" against the Chinese manufacturer of the inflatable device.

title.children: Chinese maker of jumping castle at fault, lawyer argues

image.altText: Jannik Sinner sits courtside with his hands together under his chin after losing the China Open. The net is in the foreground.

props.synopsis: Athletes and legal experts are speaking out about the apparent double standards at play in the decision to ban world number one Jannik Sinner for three months in between tennis grand slams.

title.children: Shayna Jack's lawyer takes aim at WADA over 'perplexing' Sinner ban

props.synopsis: Around-the-clock coverage of news events as they break, at home and abroad.

title.children: Watch: News Channel

image.altText: A drone shot of rows of houses in Shell Cove, Wollongong's south.

props.synopsis: The banks are under no obligation to cut their interest rates if the RBA cuts the cash rate. However, given the cost of living is such a big issue at the moment, they would face significant backlash if they didn't pass savings on to customers.

title.children: The RBA is tipped to cut rates. Here's how low they could go in 2025

image.altText: A young mother sits on grass with her three young daughters, who are all smiling at each other

props.synopsis: Australian schooling is changing, with more than 1.5 million students now attending private schools, new data reveals.

title.children: Experts decry public school funding as parents flock to private schools

image.altText: Jacob Kiplimo raises his arms

props.synopsis: Uganda's Jacob Kiplimo made the most of perfect conditions in Barcelona to take 48 seconds off the previous world record, the largest jump in history.

title.children: 'Astonishing': World half marathon record smashed by historic margin

image.altText: a man and a woman who were william tyrrell's foster parents and have to have their faces blurred in the image leave court

props.synopsis: The former foster father of William Tyrrell has successfully appealed his conviction of intimidating a different child.

title.children: William Tyrrell's former foster father has intimidation conviction overturned

image.altText: Aerial shot of the riverside Queen's Wharf development

props.synopsis: Star confirmed to the sharemarket on Monday to having received the offer from California-based Oaktree Capital Management, which deals in what is known as distressed debt.

title.children: Star offered $650m lifeline by US-based company

image.altText: 25-year-old Mikey Madison has won the 2025 BAFTA Award for best actress.

props.synopsis: Post-WWII epic The Brutalist and papal drama Conclave have tied for most wins at the 2025 BAFTA awards.

title.children: Mikey Madison takes surprise win at BAFTAs over Demi Moore

image.altText: A side profile of a woman who is sitting outside. She is looking down, looking concerned and sad.

props.synopsis: These families never imagined their loved ones would be drawn to Neo-Nazi groups. Now they're fighting to get them back and begging the government to help.

title.children: Emily recognised her son on TV. He was standing with a group of Neo-Nazis

image.altText: An birds-eye-view artist's impression of a development.

props.synopsis: The final stage of the controversial Barangaroo foreshore development will begin before the end of the year and will include residential, retail and hospitality spaces.

title.children: Barangaroo 'dustbowl' finally approved for development after 10 years

image.altText: A family walks down a dock.

props.synopsis: The third season of Mike White's 'eat the rich' series jets off to Thailand, introducing a whole host of people you'll want to strangle and locals you'll want to save.

title.children: The White Lotus season 3 shows you can have too much of a good thing

image.altText: Mobile vision of three shirtless men on a street with a crowd in the background.

props.synopsis: A chaotic brawl took place outside Finns Beach Club in Canggu last week, with footage posted to social media allegedly showing shirtless men beating security guards with wooden blocks.

title.children: Australian suspect in alleged Bali assault identified by police

image.altText: A man standing with his arms folded, looking at another man who is sitting and speaking

props.synopsis: New data shows Australians are making it clear they want answers to their economic malaise and that the obsessions of super-rich Americans are not the same as theirs.

title.children: Could Musk's unpopularity in Australia impact the election?

image.altText: Burnt-out truck trailers

props.synopsis: Last year was the deadliest year on southern Queensland roads in a decade, but 2025 is off to an even worse start.

title.children: Horror weekend on southern Queensland roads leaves three dead

image.altText: Helga Lam with blonde bob and white blazer with white sheet covering face.

props.synopsis: Former teacher Helga Lam is being pursued by the State of NSW in civil proceedings involving four men who allege they were sexually abused as students.

title.children: Boys called 'liars' after reporting teacher for alleged sexual abuse

image.altText: A blue fish front-on with a piece of kelp or feather star balanced above its beak.

props.synopsis: Numbers of eastern blue groper have halved around the Sydney coast since 2008, and the fish is being pushed south as waters warm, a new study has found.

title.children: NSW's state fish is moving south as oceans warm
